Here is MPI. Here is an enumeration

    1. global max on integer and floating point data types
    2. global min on integer and floating point data types
    3. global sum on integer and floating point data types
    4. global product on integer and floating point data types
    5. global AND on logical and integer data types
    6. global OR on logical and integer data types
    7. global XOR on logical and integer data types
    8. rank of process with maximum value
    9. rank of process with minimum value
    10. user defined (associative) operation
    11. user defined (associative and commutative) operation
which ended here. And now, a displayed equation

A x = n

This is an inline = u equation. This is an inline equation with only regular text a = ( 1,2 ) , and this one has braces { (1,2), (3,4)} . Here are the same things, but using the dollar notation:

A x = n

This is an inline epsilon = mu equation. This is an inline equation with only regular text a = ( 1,2 ), and this one has braces { (1,2), (3,4)}.

This is an inline equation with dollars: <type>.
